member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel
member.summary: The SmartAxisLabelPanel class is an axis label panel that automatically lays out its labels in a way that prevents collisions. This axis panel also provides ways to customize various label attributes, such as angle, font, font size, margins, etc.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.Extent
member.summary: Gets or sets the space reserved for labels. ExtentType can be used to display the extent in pixels or as a percentage of the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.ActualExtent
member.summary: Returns the actual extent value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowable extent value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the mamximum allowable extent value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.ExtentType
member.summary: Determines whether the extent is displayed in pixels or as a percentage of the chart.

member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the labels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.ActualAngle
member.summary: Returns the actual angle of the labels.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowable angle value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable angle value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the label font size.

member.summary: Returns actual font size value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.MinimumFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowable font size.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.MaximumFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowable font size.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.NumberOfStaggerLevels
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of stagger levels. Staggering only applies to horizontal labels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.MinimumStaggerLevels
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum allowable number of stagger levels. The default value is 1.

member.summary: Returns the actual number of stagger levels.

member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the labels.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.TopMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the margin at the top of the labels. Only applies when the labels are top-aligned.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.ProximityMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum amount of white space between two labels. When two adjacent labels are within this margin they are considered to be overlapping.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.CategoryWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of a single category

member.summary: Gets the longest axis label

member.summary: Gets the longest label without breaks or the longest part of a label with breaks

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.DisplayType
member.summary: Returns the orientation/arrangement of axis labels

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.ShouldResize
member.summary: Determines if the panel should be resized. Normally the panel's height remains unchanged when various properties change. However, should there be a need to resize the height, this property can be used for that. If it's already set to true, setting it to false should have no effect. Only MeasureOverride is allowed to do that.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.LabelsChanged
member.summary: When true, causes visible label strings to be recreated. This can happen when the datasource gets replaced.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the smart axis panel.

member.summary: Calculates the top y-coord of labels based on the panel's location, title, tickmarks and other margin properties

member.summary: if this returns true, then text wrapping can and should be used

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HorizontalSmartAxisLabelPanel.ShouldUseRotation
member.summary: Here we should return true for any case that we know results in rotated labels. Returning false doesn't necessarily mean that the labels will be horizontal. However, returning true guarantees rotation.

member.summary: Finds the width needed to fit labels horizontally.

member.summary: Returns an angle between 0 and 180.

member.remarks: Gets or sets the set value is a factor that determines which labels will be hidden. For example, an interval of 2 will display every other label.

member.remarks: Gets or sets the set value is a factor that determines how the minor lines will be displayed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between each label and grid line along the Y-axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CartesianChart.YAxisIsLogarithmic
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Y-axis should use a logarithmic scale instead of a linear one.
member.remarks: Since log(-1) is imaginary and log(0) is undefined, it is recommended to enable this property only when the Y-axis minimum is greater than zero.

member.summary: Gets or sets the base value to use in the log function when mapping the position of data items along the Y-axis.
member.remarks: This property is effective only when YAxisIsLogarithmic is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CategoryChart.ItemsSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of data items used to generate the chart.
member.remarks: Value of this property can be a list of objects containing one or more numeric properties. Additionally, if the objects in the list implement the IEnumerable interface, the Category Chart will attempt to delve into the sub-collections when reading through the data source. Databinding can be further configured by attributing the data item classes with the DataSeriesMemberIntentAttribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CategoryChart.IncludedProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets a set of property paths that should be included for consideration by the category chart, leaving the remaineder excluded. If null, all properties will be considered.

member.summary: Gets or sets a set of property paths that should be excluded from consideration by the category chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DomainChart.ItemsSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of data items used to generate the chart.
member.remarks: The ItemsSource of this chart can be a list of objects containing one or more numeric properties. Additionally, if the objects in the list implement the IEnumerable interface, the Chart will attempt to delve into the sub-collections when reading through the data source. Databinding can be further configured by attributing the data item classes with the DataSeriesMemberIntentAttribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.DomainChart.Resolution

member.remarks: This property applies only to these chart types: point, line, spline, bubble, and polygon

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CategoryXAxis.ScrollRangeIntoView(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Scrolls the CategoryXAxis so that the provided range is brought into view.
member.param: The minimum category index to bring into view.
The maximum category index to bring into view.
member.remarks:
This method adjusts the WindowRect in order to scroll horizontally to the desired location. This means that the X axis zoom level may change as it tries to fit the minimum and maximum in view. It will not adjust the Y axis zoom level.
Note: The minimum and maximum are expected to be indexes referring to the items inside the CategoryXAxis ItemsSource.

member.summary: Creates a wrapper around a collection that asserts that access to the items is readonly and that Double.NaN and Double.(Positive/Negative)Infinity values are coerced to safe values for calculation and rendering. member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner
member.summary: Utility class for range partitioning.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner.PartitionByValue``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},``0,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.remarks:
The list is reordered such that list[0] to list[k-1] are less than list[k] and all items list[k+1] to list[list.Count-1] are greater than list[k].
The items within the upper and lower subranges are in no particular order, and specifically are not sorted.
member.param: List of values to partition.
Pivot value.
Index of first item in subrange.
Index of last item in subrange.
member.returns: Index of first item greater than the specified pivot value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner.PartitionByValue``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Int32},``0,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: List of values.
List of indices to partition.
Pivot value.
Index of first index in subrange.
Index of last index in subrange.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner.Partition``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the kth biggest item in the current list object and partitions the list accordingly.
member.remarks:
The list is reordered such that list[0] to list[k-1] are less than list[k] and all items list[k+1] to list[list.Count-1] are greater than list[k].
The items within the upper and lower subranges are in no particular order, and specifically are not sorted.
member.param: List object to partition.
Pivot item order.
member.returns: Pivot item value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Util.Partitioner.Partition``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the kth biggest item in the specified subrange of the current list object and partitions it accordingly.
member.remarks:
The list is reordered such that list[position] to list[position+k-1] are less than list[position+k] and all items list[position+k+1] to list[position+Count] are greater than list[k].
The items within the upper and lower subranges are in no particular order, and specifically are not sorted.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.Series.Legend
member.summary: Gets or sets a legend for the current series object.
member.remarks:
If the Legend property is not set, the series will use the setting according to the parent XamDataChart's Legend property.
This is generally expressed as an element name binding, as the Legend must exist at some other position in the layout. This property only indicates which Legend to use and will not alone cause the legend to be visible.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HighlightingMode
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for series highlighting depending on distance of mouse on hover operation.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HighlightingMode.Closest
member.summary: Specifies the highlight starts on closest element of series

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.HighlightingMode.DirectlyOver
member.summary: Specifies the highlight starts when directly over element of series

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for performing hit testing in the chart/map.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.Auto
member.summary: Automatically decide the appropriate hit test mode for the content.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.Computational
member.summary: Use a computational based approach to determine which series has been hit. This uses loose bounding boxes, in some cases, and can range in time complexity between O(1) and O(log n) to find a hit. This decreases frame render time compared to color encoded.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.ColorEncoded
member.summary: Use a color encoded off screen buffer for hit testing. This can have extremely rare false positives where the wrong series is hit (this is due to our inability to disable anti-aliasing in our color buffer), but should always be O(1) time for determining a hit series. This increases frame render time, however. Consider using this if hit testing time is degrading performance.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.Mixed
member.summary: Let each series decide which hit testing mode to use individually based on their own hit test mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ChartHitTestMode.MixedFavoringComputational
member.summary: Let each series decide which hit testing mode to use individually based on their own hit test mode, but evaluate all computational hits before evaluating any color encoding hits.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.SeriesHitTestMode
member.summary: Describes available behaviors for performing hit testing in the chart/map.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.SeriesHitTestMode.Auto
member.summary: Automatically decide the appropriate hit test mode for the series.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.SeriesHitTestMode.Computational
member.summary: Use a computational based approach to determine whether the series has been hit. This uses loose bounding boxes, in some cases, and can range in time complexity between O(1) and O(log n) to find a hit. This decreases frame render time compared to color encoded.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.SeriesHitTestMode.ColorEncoded
member.summary: Use a color encoded off screen buffer for hit testing. Should always be O(1) time for determining a hit series. This increases frame render time and memory usage, however. Consider using this if hit testing time is degrading performance.

Number of Items in the Queue.
This function will append to the end of the Queue or create The first Node instance.
This function will serve from the front of the Queue. Notice no deallocation for the Node Class, This is now handled by the Garbage Collector.
The Node class holds the object and a pointer to the next Node class.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer
member.summary: Represents the base class for annotation layer types. Annotations will usually disable some of the default hover/touch behaviors of the chart when they are introduced to the series collection. In return they provide some valuable information as the cursor is moved by hovering over the chart, or performing a press-hold-drag interaction in touch mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.AnnotationLayer.CursorPosition
member.summary:
Gets or sets the world position to use instead of the pointer position for this annotation layer. If you set this value, rather than responding to the pointer, this layer will be fixed on the provided world position. A world position has x and y values that range from 0 to 1 that represent the global position of the cursor relative to the entire ranges of the axes. The default of (NaN, NaN) means that the layer should react to pointer movement.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CategoryHighlightLayer
member.summary:
Represents an annotation layer that targets a category axis, or all category axes in the chart. If the axis contains any series that are aligned between major gridlines of the axis (column, waterfall, etc) this will render a shape that fills the current category. Otherwise it will render a band with an adjustable thickness at the closest gridline to the pointer position.
Setting UseIterpolation to true will cause the x position in the latter case to become affixed to the x position of the pointer.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CategoryItemHighlightLayer
member.summary:
Represents an annotation layer that highlights items in a series that use a category axis either by drawing a banded shape at their position, or by rendering a marker at their position.
Depending on the type of series, the default highlight will be affected. To override the type of highlight used, you can set the HighlightType property.

member.summary: Returns a distance value (not necessarily pixels), that indicates how 'close' a world position is to an indexed value in the series. Not every series can necessarily answer this question, it can't or the world position or index is invalid, NaN will be returned.
member.param: The world position for which to get a distance.
The index to get a distance to.
The axis in context.
The scaler parameters in context.
member.returns: A distance value to the world position.

If true, interpolation should be used to get in-between values, rather than only the actual values in the data set.

member.summary: Determines the distance to the corner on the cartesian axis aligned bounding rectangle that is furthest from the provided point.

The cartesian axis aligned rectangle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolarAxisRenderingManager.GetClosestRadiusValue(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Determines the smallest radius that is visible in the current view into the chart.
member.param: The window rectangle.
member.returns: The radius value.
member.remarks:
This makes use of the fact that the view into the chart is aligned on the cartesian axes.
So, if the center point of the chart is inside the viewable space, the minimum radius is 0.
If the view into the chart is scrolled above or below the center point, such that the center point is in the X range of the view, then the closest radius is just the distance to the top or bottom edge of the window rectangle.
Similarly, if the view into the chart is left of right of the center point, such that the center point is in the Y range of the view, then the closest radius is just the distance to the left of right edge of the window rectangle.
In the case where the view is deeper into the quadrants of the space, and the center point is neither in the X or Y range of the view, then we simply need to determine what the distance is to the closest corner of the rectangle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolarAxisRenderingManager.GetFurthestRadiusValue(System.Windows.Rect)
member.summary: Determines the furthest radius value that is viewable in the current view into the chart.
member.param: The window rectangle.
member.returns: The radius value.
member.remarks: In all cases the furthest distance will just be the distance to the furthest corner of the viewing rectangle in scaled viewport space.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.TimeAxisInterval

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseIndicatorCalculationStrategy
member.summary: Represents a decoupled strategy for calculating a financial indicator from data provided by a financial series. Will be called seperately for each item.
member.remarks: The data which the strategy will use for its calculation is a simplified subset of the data that the series makes available and is defined by the contract

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseIndicatorCalculationStrategy.CalculateIndicatorItem(Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource,Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialCalculationSupportingCalculations,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the calculation associated with this calculation strategy for one item.
member.param: The data required by the contract between these strategies and the financial series.
The calculation strategies required by the contract between these strategies and the finiancial series.
The index in the indicator collection to calculate.
member.returns: True if the calculation could be completed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseIndicatorCalculationStrategy.BasedOn(Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource,Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialCalculationSupportingCalculations)
member.summary: The calculation strategy is required to express which columns its values are based on so that the series knows when to ask for recalculation.
member.param: The data source we will be calculating for.
The supporting calculations to be used in the calculation.
member.returns: The list of column names that this calculation is based on.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseStrategyBasedIndicator
member.summary: Financial indicator base class for doing calculating an itemwize indicator.
member.remarks: An itemwise indicator's individual values don't depend on any other values in the collection so can always be independently recalculated. Also, because of this, the base class handles all the looping logic and inheritors only need to provide the actual calculation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseStrategyBasedIndicator.CalculationStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the strategy to use for the calculation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseStrategyBasedIndicator.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs the ItemwiseStrategyBasedIndicator.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseStrategyCalculationStrategy
member.summary: Indicator calculation strategy that handles applying an itemwise strategy to the indicator values that are requested to be calculated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseStrategyCalculationStrategy.ItemwiseStrategy
member.summary: The strategy that will be applied itemwize across the calculation.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ItemwiseStrategyCalculationStrategy.BasedOn(Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialCalculationDataSource,Infragistics.Controls.Charts.FinancialCalculationSupportingCalculations)
member.summary: Exposes which columns this strategy uses in its calculation so that the consumers will know when they should ask the strategy to recalculate.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.StrategyBasedIndicator
member.summary: A base class for indicator series with simple calculations that separates the calculation responsibility from the other responsibilities of the financial series, this enables easier unit testing and decoupling of individual calculation strategies.
member.remarks: A contract is defined between the financial series and these simple indicator calculations detailing the data which the series agrees to provide the simple indicator calculations, this contract is defined by . If more complex interactions are needed between the indicator calculation and the series, the indicators should instead derive from directly, or some derivative other than

member.summary: No labels will be displayed.

member.summary: Labels will be displayed in the center.

member.summary: Labels will be displayed inside and by the edge of the container.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.LeaderLineType
member.summary: Describes available types of a callout line for the labels.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.LeaderLineType.Straight
member.summary: A straight line is drawn between the slice and its label.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.LeaderLineType.Arc
member.summary: A curved line is drawn between the slice and its label. The line follows makes a natural turn from the slice to the label.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.LeaderLineType.Spline
member.summary: A curved line is drawn between the slice and its label. The line starts radially from the slice and then turns to the label.

member.summary: Describes available behaviors for calculating and grouping slices into the Others slice.

member.summary: Data value is compared directly to the value of OthersCategoryThreshold.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.OthersCategoryType.Percent
member.summary: Data value is compared to OthersCategoryThreshold as a percentage of the total.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.CategoryYAxis.ScrollRangeIntoView(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Scrolls the CategoryYAxis so that the provided range is brought into view.
member.param: The minimum category index to bring into view.
The maximum category index to bring into view.
member.remarks:
This method adjusts the WindowRect in order to scroll vertically to the desired location. This means that the Y axis zoom level may change as it tries to fit the minimum and maximum in view. It will not adjust the X axis zoom level.
Note: The minimum and maximum are expected to be indexes referring to the items inside the CategoryYAxis ItemsSource.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolylineBuilder
member.summary: Utility class for piecewise construction of indexed polylines.
member.remarks: This class represents polyline point as integer ids with the assumption that two vertices are identical if they have identical ids. The class itself has no need for any vertex-specific information such as its coordinates.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolylineBuilder.Clear
member.summary: Clears all polylines from the current object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolylineBuilder.GetPolylines
member.summary: Gets the list of polylines for the current object.
member.remarks: There may be zero or more constructed polylines each of length two or more. A polyline is represented as a list of integer ids as passed to the AddSegment method. Polylines do not contain self-intersections or adjacent coincident point. A polyline may form a loop, in which case its first and last point are identical.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.PolylineBuilder.AddSegment(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a segment to the current object.
member.param: Id of the first point in the segment
Id of the end point in the segment

member.summary: Utility class for piecewise construction of edge-based contours.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ContourBuilder.Clear
member.summary: Clears all polylines and point from the current object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ContourBuilder.X
member.summary: Gets the list of x coordinates for the line in the current object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ContourBuilder.Y
member.summary: Gets the list of y coordinates for the line in the current object.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ContourBuilder.Point(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates an edge point for the current object and returns its point id.
member.remarks: The begin and edge point ids are hashed to produce a unique point id. The current implementation of the hash function is reliable for ids of less than 65536.
member.param: Edge begin point id
Edge end point id
Edge begin point x coordinate.
Edge begin point y coordinate.
Edge begin point z coordinate.
Edge end point x coordinate.
Edge end point y coordinate.
Edge end point z coordinate.
Contour v.
member.returns: Unique vertex id.

member.summary: Identifies the ShapeFilterResolution dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.ShapeSeriesBase.ShapeFilterResolution
member.summary: The resolution at which to filter out shapes in the series. For example, if the ShapeFilterResolution is set to 3, then elements with a bounding rectangle smaller than 3 X 3 pixels will be filtered out.
member.remarks: In the case of ScatterPolylineSeries, the resolution is compared to either dimension, rather than both. In other words, a polyline will not be filtered if its height or its width exceeds the value of this property. Whereas with a ShapeSeries, both the height and the width must exceed the value of this property.

member.summary: The source of triangulation data.
member.remarks: This property is optional. If it is left as null, the triangulation will be created based on the items in the ItemsSource. Triangulation is a demanding operation, so the runtime performance will be better when specifying a TriangulationSource, especially when a large number of data items are present.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamDomainChart.ItemsSource
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of data items used to generate the chart.
member.remarks: The ItemsSource of this chart can be a list of objects containing one or more numeric properties. Additionally, if the objects in the list implement the IEnumerable interface, the Chart will attempt to delve into the sub-collections when reading through the data source. Databinding can be further configured by attributing the data item classes with the DataSeriesMemberIntentAttribute.

member.remarks: When the legend property is set, the chart will use it to display information about its series. Legends can be shared by multiple chart controls.

member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.Charts.XamDomainChart.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering resolution for all series in this chart.
member.remarks: Where n = Resolution, for every n horizontal pixels, combine all items into a single datapoint. When Resolution = 0, all datapoints will be rendered as graphical objects. Charts with a higher resolution will have faster performance.

member.summary: Gets or sets which legend to use for all series in this SeriesViewer, unless otherwise specified by the Series.Legend property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowRect
member.summary: A rectangle representing the portion of the SeriesViewer currently in view.
member.remarks: A rectangle at X=0, Y=0 with a Height and Width of 1 implies the entire plotting area is in view. A Height and Width of .5 would imply that the view is halfway zoomed in.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowResponse
member.summary: The response to user panning and zooming: whether to update the view immediately while the user action is happening, or to defer the update to after the user action is complete. The user action will be an action such as a mouse drag which causes panning and/or zooming to occur.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.WindowRectMinWidth
member.summary:
Sets or gets the minimum width that the window rect is allowed to reach before being clamped. Decrease this value if you want to allow for further zooming into the viewer. If this value is lowered too much it can cause graphical corruption due to floating point arithmetic inaccuracy.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.ShouldKeepResourcesOnUnload
member.summary:
Gets or sets a whether the series viewer's components should hold their resource when unloaded.
This is a dependency property.
Note, when setting this to true, it becomes the user's responsibility to set the ItemsSource of the various series and axes to null when the chart is unloaded or memory leaks will occur. This property is useful however, if unloaded charts must be examined or printed, or when expensive to load charts are on multiple tabs on a tab control.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.ShouldKeepResourcesOnUnloadProperty
member.summary: Identifies the ShouldKeepResourcesOnUnload dependency property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Controls.SeriesViewer.Flush
member.summary: Use to force the SeriesViewer to finish any deferred work before printing or evaluating its visual.
member.remarks: This should only be called if the visual of the SeriesViewer needs to be synchronously saved or evaluated. Calling this method too often will hinder the performance of the SeriesViewer.
